title: Was it easier to plead insane in the past, and how has the insanity plea been changed over the course of US history? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: My frame of reference is Canadian and my hands on experience does not engage until mid 80’s so the value of my answer is limited. The defence, defined in s. 16 of our criminal code, remains narrowly prescribed. It is not a specific plea, although often so misunderstood (even amongst my Canadian colleagues) , rather a defence negating mens rea. Changes have been largely cosmetic: the language changed from “not guilty by reason of insanity” (NGRI) to “not criminally responsible” (NCR). Thanks for the ask. Sandberg
